alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 10:01AM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River near Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Platte River near Darr. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Thursday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river gauge near Darr is expected to continue to fluctuate between slightly above and very near minor flood stage for several more days to come. The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue rising to 10.6 feet early Monday afternoon. Please note that confidence in this forecast decreases farther out in time, especially beyond the next 2 to 3 days, as factors such as additional rainfall near and upstream of the Dawson County area could alter later forecasts at least slightly. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
